note.p: Education: School at Northampton; Lincoln College, Oxford; BA (1704), MA (1707), BMed, DMed (1714); studied with his relative Thomas Wagstaffe, nonjuror bishop and physician
Career: Reader on Anatomy to the Barber-Surgeons (1715); Physician to St Bartholomew's Hospital (1720-1725); went to Bath on account of his poor health
Sources: Bulloch's Roll; DNB; Foster; Munk's Roll
Notes: Foster says father was of Daventry, Northamptonshire; Munk says Wagstaffe was born in Northamptonshire
